properties.entry: SELECT PROVENANCE sum(i) * null FROM r;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(i) * null FROM r GROUP BY r.i;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(i) FROM r GROUP BY r.i;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(i), r.i FROM r GROUP BY r.i;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(four) FROM muchcols GROUP BY one;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(four) AS sum FROM muchcols GROUP BY one HAVING sum(four) > 1000;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(sump) FROM (SELECT sum(i.price) AS sump FROM item i, sales s WHERE i.id = s.item_id GROUP BY s.shop_id) AS sub;
SELECT PROVENANCE count(DISTINCT id) FROM bagdiff4;
SELECT PROVENANCE count(*) FROM muchcols GROUP BY one,two, three;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(id) FROM bagdiff3 GROUP BY (id < 3);
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(id) FROM bagdiff3 GROUP BY (id / 5);
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(sub.sum) FROM (SELECT sum(id) AS sum FROM aggr GROUP BY (id / 2)) AS sub;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(sub.sum) FROM (SELECT sum(sub.sum),(id / 2) AS id FROM (SELECT sum(id) AS sum,(id / 2) AS id FROM aggr GROUP BY (id / 2)) AS sub GROUP BY (id / 2)) AS sub;

SELECT PROVENANCE sum(sub.sum) FROM (SELECT sum(sub.sum),(id / 2) AS id FROM (SELECT sum(sub.sum),(id / 2) AS id FROM (SELECT sum(id) AS sum,(id / 2) AS id FROM aggr GROUP BY (id / 2)) AS sub GROUP BY (id / 2)) AS sub GROUP BY (id / 2)) AS sub;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(sumid) FROM (SELECT sum(sumid) AS sumid FROM (SELECT sum(sumid) AS sumid FROM (SELECT sum(id) AS sumid FROM aggr) AS sub) AS sub) as sub;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(id) / avg(id) FROM bagdiff1;

SELECT PROVENANCE sum(sa.price) AS total_sales FROM shop sh, (SELECT i.price * s.number_items AS price, shop_id FROM item i, sales s WHERE i.id = s.item_id) AS sa WHERE sh.id = sa.shop_id GROUP BY sh.id;

SELECT PROVENANCE avg(profit) AS avg_prof FROM (SELECT (sales - costs) AS profit FROM (SELECT sum(sa.price) AS sales, sh.id AS shop_id FROM shop sh, (SELECT i.price * s.number_items AS price, shop_id FROM item i, sales s WHERE i.id = s.item_id) AS sa WHERE sh.id = sa.shop_id GROUP BY sh.id) AS sales_per_shop, (SELECT sum(em.salary) AS costs, sh.id AS shop_id FROM shop sh, employee em, employee_works_at_shop wo WHERE wo.employee_id = em.id AND wo.shop_id = sh.id GROUP BY sh.id) AS costs_per_shop WHERE sales_per_shop.shop_id = costs_per_shop.shop_id) as prof;

SELECT DISTINCT (avg_prof = orig_avg_prof) FROM (SELECT PROVENANCE avg(profit) AS avg_prof FROM (SELECT (sales - costs) AS profit FROM (SELECT sum(sa.price) AS sales, sh.id AS shop_id FROM shop sh, (SELECT i.price * s.number_items AS price, shop_id FROM item i, sales s WHERE i.id = s.item_id) AS sa WHERE sh.id = sa.shop_id GROUP BY sh.id) AS sales_per_shop, (SELECT sum(em.salary) AS costs, sh.id AS shop_id FROM shop sh, employee em, employee_works_at_shop wo WHERE wo.employee_id = em.id AND wo.shop_id = sh.id GROUP BY sh.id) AS costs_per_shop WHERE sales_per_shop.shop_id = costs_per_shop.shop_id) as prof ) AS prov, (SELECT avg(profit) AS orig_avg_prof FROM (SELECT (sales - costs) AS profit FROM (SELECT sum(sa.price) AS sales, sh.id AS shop_id FROM shop sh, (SELECT i.price * s.number_items AS price, shop_id FROM item i, sales s WHERE i.id = s.item_id) AS sa WHERE sh.id = sa.shop_id GROUP BY sh.id) AS sales_per_shop, (SELECT sum(em.salary) AS costs, sh.id AS shop_id FROM shop sh, employee em, employee_works_at_shop wo WHERE wo.employee_id = em.id AND wo.shop_id = sh.id GROUP BY sh.id) AS costs_per_shop WHERE sales_per_shop.shop_id = costs_per_shop.shop_id) as prof ) AS orig;
SELECT PROVENANCE DISTINCT sum(id) FROM employee;

sum | prov_public_employee_id | prov_public_employee_first__name | prov_public_employee_last__name | prov_public_employee_salary -----+-------------------------+---------------------------------+--------------------------------+----------------------------- 36 | 1 | Peter | Meter | 10000 36 | 3 | Heinz | Heller | 15000 36 | 4 | Fritz | Knoten | 9000 36 | 5 | Boris | Heinzer | 5000 36 | 6 | Gert | Gertsen | 12000 36 | 7 | Doris | Dorissen | 3000 36 | 8 | Walter | Ott | 2000 36 | 2 | Getrud | Muller | 8000
SELECT PROVENANCE DISTINCT * FROM (SELECT sum(id) FROM employee) AS sub;

sum | prov_public_employee_id | prov_public_employee_first__name | prov_public_employee_last__name | prov_public_employee_salary -----+-------------------------+---------------------------------+--------------------------------+----------------------------- 36 | 1 | Peter | Meter | 10000 36 | 3 | Heinz | Heller | 15000 36 | 4 | Fritz | Knoten | 9000 36 | 5 | Boris | Heinzer | 5000 36 | 6 | Gert | Gertsen | 12000 36 | 7 | Doris | Dorissen | 3000 36 | 8 | Walter | Ott | 2000 36 | 2 | Getrud | Muller | 8000
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(nonnu) FROM bagdiff4 GROUP BY id;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(a) AS suma FROM x GROUP BY a ORDER BY a;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(i) AS suma FROM r GROUP BY i ORDER BY i;
select provenance sum(a) AS rev, c FROM x, v WHERE x.a = v.d GROUP BY x.b, v.c, x.a;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(a) AS rev, c FROM x, v WHERE x.a = v.d GROUP BY x.b, v.c, x.a ORDER BY rev, v.c;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(i) AS sumi FROM r GROUP BY i ORDER BY sumi;
SELECT PROVENANCE COUNT(*), r.i FROM r JOIN s ON r.i = s.i GROUP BY r.i;
SELECT PROVENANCE * FROM (SELECT COUNT(*), r.i FROM r JOIN s ON r.i = s.i GROUP BY r.i) AS sub;
SELECT PROVENANCE r.i FROM r GROUP BY r.i;
SELECT PROVENANCE sum(su) FROM (SELECT sum(b) AS su FROM t1 GROUP BY a) AS sub;
